fermentables.notes: Pre-cooked, non-malted cereals provide the brewer with the opportunity for product differentiation. Flaked products can be added directly to the mash without the need for milling.
fermentables.name: Torrefied Wheat
Wheat Malt
fermentables.notes: Even when used in small quantities will improve foam and head retention in all beers. Huskless grain - use rice hulls when using high percentages
Used to adjust colour and flavour of ales, giving deep golden to red hues
fermentables.name: Medium Crystal 240

fermentables.notes: Provides a smoothness to Porters and other dark beers
fermentables.name: Brown Malt

hops.name: Admiral
hops.usedIn: nglish Bitters, Pale Ales and IPA’s, Continental or Czech Pilsners
hops.notes: Bred from Challenger and Northdown. Not as harsh as Target, but very mild aromatics so used in combination with other varieties for late-hopping and dry hopping. Compact cones with high Alpha levels and a subtle but pleasant fresh hoppy aroma.Provides good background bitterness for beers where large quantities of very low alpha aroma hops such as Fuggles/ Goldings are typically used, e.g. English Bitters, Pale Ales and IPA’s, or with Aramis/ Saaz in Continental or Czech Pilsners

hops.name: Endeavour
hops.notes: Bred at Wye Hops in the UK as a cross between Cascade and a hedgerow hop. A wonderful, citrusy hedgerow hop with complex blackcurrant, loganberry and spicy notes as well as grapefruit and lime flavor. Gentler than cascade. Substitutes: Cascade

hops.usedIn: English Bitters, Pale Ale, Porter, Stout, Czech Pilsner, Bock, Cask Ale, Wheat ...
hops.notes:
Progress was originally introduced as a replacement for Fuggle and has very similar characteristics. Slightly sweeter and with a slightly softer bitterness it is has excellent potential at both the start and end of the boil.
Characteristics: Sweet flavour, Fuggle-like aromas of grass, mint and earth. Subtle bitterness.
hops.name: Progress

yeasts.description: This yeast is a little more attenuative than WLP002. Like most English strains, this yeast produces malty beers. Excellent for all English style ales including bitter, pale ale, porter, and brown ale.
yeasts.name: British Ale
